```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}

while(T){
    N = sample(3:4,1)
    v = sort(sample(c("A","B","C","D","E","F","G","H","J","K","L","M","N","P","Q","R","S","T","W","X","Y","Z"),N))
    iters = sample(3:5,1)
    start = paste0(sample(v,sample(1:3,1),T),collapse="")
    rules = list()
    for(i in 1:N){
        rplc = paste0(sample(v,sample(2:4,1),T),collapse="")
        rules[[v[i]]] = rplc
    }
    
    s = strsplit(start,"")[[1]]
    strings = c(start)
    
    for(j in 1:iters){
        s2 = s
        for(i in 1:length(s)){
            s2[i] = rules[[s[i]]]
        }
        s2 = paste0(s2,collapse="")
        strings = c(strings,s2)
        s = strsplit(s2,"")[[1]]
    }
    if(length(unique(s))==N && length(s)<100 && length(s)>40){break}
}
# print(start)
# print(rules)
# print(strings)

printrules = paste0("  * ",names(rules)," $\\to$ ",rules,collapse="\n")

sol = strings[iters+1]
```

Question
========

Consider the [L system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L-system) defined by the following start and replacement rules:

* Start = `r start`
* Rules:
`r printrules`

After `r iters` iterations, what string is developed? I'd recommend using [this tool](https://chadworley.github.io/Lsys_string_gen.html).
